132121111111.title: One

133.content:
“Give me another double!” I shouted.

“You got it!” the barkeep replied, quickly sending back my vice - a double shot of the cheapest whiskey they had.

I loved this place. 3 minutes walk from my house, dirt cheap liquor, and they didn’t care about overserving me ever since I became a regular. This was the spot I came to to reflect on life.

When I was 18 I left home, not wanting anything to do with anybody I had ever met. Family, friends, classmates. Some of them I got along with, but all of them were a toxic mix of juvenile, stupid and shallow; a combination that was overly prevalent in my small town.

It hadn’t been too hard to get better grades than everyone else growing up in my town - the SAT wasn’t too hard, and grades were a joke because of my competition. I later found out, having a good SAT score and high grades didn’t mean I was smart; it just made me complacent. So when I finally got into college, with a full scholarship at one of the best schools in my state, I knew I was going to turn over a new leaf.

I was wrong. I took another large sip of my drink. It didn’t matter that it tasted awful, it dulled the pain I had felt. All of that was 7 years ago, and everything went downhill fast. Trying to major in Computer Science was a no-go. They made plenty of money, but everyone else in my classes had experience, and no professor would slow down. If I had picked an easier major maybe things would have gone better, but I hadn’t.

It wasn’t far into my college career before I could barely stay afloat. Doing homework was a drag, but not doing it tanked my grades. Exams were asking things that didn’t matter, just to try and throw people off their game. And of course, there were no girls in any of my classes - they either went to better schools out of state, or other majors. There were beautiful girls all around, as is common on college campuses. But none of them would ever even give me the time of day. All they cared about were appearances, and were shallow. 3 years before dropping out and I didn’t get a single date, or make a single friend who I could talk to once a class was over.

I was out of money, and kicked out of the school. I could have left and gone somewhere else, but all I had were burned bridges. I had no experience or skills, no interests and nowhere I knew of to go. So I stuck around, doing whatever odd jobs I could get - busboy, grocery bagger, you name it. But they were all just boring and the only thing I had to do now anymore was try and figure out what I could have done to not get into this situation.

“One more!” I yelled again, slurring slightly now.

“You got another 3 days before the kids come back and I can’t keep serving you like this” the bartender replied, filling me up another glass.

While being a regular and being close by was great, they couldn’t serve me like this while school was in session. These guys were not the most legitimate business, but still had to make sure not to be too reckless with the number of people that showed up. During the school year I couldn’t step foot in this place amongst all the trendy little spoiled brats coming to party.

I was nursing my drink, getting ready to call it quits, when one of the most beautiful girls I had seen in a while walked in. Mid-20s, very leggy, silky brunette hair, slight heeled sandals and a modest but still provocative summer dress. And then she sat next to me.

“Could I have a goose shake” she asked, her voice smooth but confident. A far cry from any of the girls that would normally visit this bar during the year.

“Getting one last drink in before those annoying kids come back to school?” I asked, shifting my drink around.

She looked over at me puzzled for a second, before presenting one of the friendliest smiles I had ever seen.

“You could say that. I love a good party as much as the next girl, but this is the last time this place will be quiet for a good 3 months.” she explained while looking my way.

This was my chance.

“You look too old to be a student. Did you graduate with some stupid major and get stuck here or something?” I asked

Her face instantly turned to shock, before her eyes fell on the bar. I looked over to see my small pile of glasses left over, and my almost still full drink.

“I’ll let that one go. It looks like you’re already pretty deep and it’s not good to drink alone. Seems like you’ve had a hard time. If you want someone to hear your story and sympathize with, I don’t mind.”

“What are you, some kind of shrink?” I asked, not sure if she was genuine or whether there was some ulterior motive.

“Not a shrink, or anything like that. I like to think of myself as pretty altruistic. By the end of tonight, I’m sure I can figure out something that could lift your spirits.”

Tonight might have been the luckiest night of my life. And from what I could tell, if I played my card right, maybe I could get luckier still.

Over the next 40 minutes I wove a slightly embellished tale of my struggles and focused mainly on the hardships from unfair professors. It didn’t matter that I had 15 chances to do well in a class, since the 16th one was always sabotaged. I had let some more than I’d wanted loose, but I was pretty far gone by this point and my impulse control was shot.

“Sounds like you had a rough time. I’m not really the type to impart blame on anyone, but it seems like you wish you had another shot.”

She was spot on. As much as I was getting sick of students, there’s nothing I wouldn’t give for one more shot.

“I’d give anything to go back and do it all again. Maybe if I had some stronger motivation to finish, I wouldn’t have gotten into this mess again.” I replied.

“Well, I’m not sure what I can do about that, but I’m sure I can do something to lift your mood.” she said, looking me up and down.

“I’m guessing with all the drinking you did, you’ve got a place nearby? How about we go there, I want a bit more privacy.” she asked.

Jackpot.

Some scrawny little nerd like you could probably find a girl if you worked on improving yourself, but you just dismiss it as girls being shallow and not recognizing you, all while you’re lusting and chasing after the shallow girls.

I’m sporting enough though - I’ll still get you a job so you can pay me back, but I’ll only turn you back once you have paid me back, in full, and have a degree.”

As time and technology marches forwards, so does crime and the criminals who commit them. Once most stores went high-tech, to a point where cash became almost nonexistent, there were no longer robberies, since there was no physical money to steal. And once malls invested in the auto-consultants, there was limited staff, and limited merchandise left out. The way most stores worked were that you'd request an item, and it'd be brought to you. Appliances, clothes, pretty much everything was procured through that system. Which made shoplifting extremely hard. However, some criminals just don't know when to quit.

Nate was one of those criminals. His specialty was breaking into the new high-tech malls, and instead of lifting merchandise, he'd break into the machines and steal parts, which went for top dollar on the black market, given the proprietary materials used in their creation. It was easy enough to do, first he'd hack their cameras, since they still had humans monitoring them, and load up the previous night's tape, then he'd go in through the vents, emerge in the targeted store, and with everything deactivated for the night, he'd be able to pop open the machines and take what he wanted. Tonight, he was aiming for a motherboard from the Forge Hill Mall. Everything was going off without a hitch...

Nate dropped to the ground and brushed himself off. He looked around the room, it was dark except for ambient lighting.

"Let's see, where's the main system..." Nate pulled out a flashlight and pointed it around.

He spotted a large device with several ports towards the rear of the room, which is where all the smart-tech was housed.

"Jackpot." Nate smiled and reached into his bag for his tools.

He approached the machine, opened a hatch, and started removing parts, when suddenly, there was a spark, and all the lights turned on in the room. Nate froze as metallic appendages emerged from the ports and immediately seized his arms and legs.

"SECURITY SYSTEM ACTIVE: IDENTIFY YOURSELF!" a robotic voice stated.

Nate hadn't planned for this, Forge Hill didn't have a security system as far as his records went. He had to be smart about this.

"Uh... I'm a... customer?" Nate said.

The systems are usually very binary in thinking, so telling it that he was a customer should force it to let him go, and then he could escape and call this night a wash.

"CUSTOMER... ONE MILLIONTH CUSTOMER! CONGRATULATIONS!"

Happy music started to play. Nate struggled against the appendages, but to no avail.

"Uh, thanks?" Nate said.

"SCANNING CUSTOMER FOR PARAMETERS FOR FREE MAKEOVER!"

"I'm not interested, sorry. I just want to go now." Nate said.

The machine ignored him and continued scanning.

"PARAMETERS SET. COMMENCING MAKEOVER."

The arms pulled him out of the central computer room, and out into the mall proper, bringing Nate inside what he recognized as a changing room.

"NAME, PLEASE."

"My name is Nate." he said.

"USER IDENTIFIED AS KATE."

"Wait, no I said Nate!" Nate screamed as the appendages started to strip Nate's clothes off.

Once he was completely naked, Nate was sprayed down by a nozzle from his neck down. He didn't know what he was sprayed with, but it started to burn the longer it sat on his body.

"Get it off! It burns!" Nate screamed.

At this point, the security video would have been watched, and the authorities would have been sent in to deactivate the system and arrest Nate, which would have been preferable to him, but because he hacked the cameras, no one would ever see what happened to him.

A few minutes passed, and the nozzle returned, but spraying cold water onto Nate. As the water washed off the spray, it took with it all of his body hair, leaving Nate within the grasp of the appendages, shivering and wet. But not for long. Another set of appendages arrived and sprayed him with warm air to dry him off, before most of the appendages then retracted, only to return a moment later with several attachments. The first two appeared to be suction cups and immediately seized upon Nate's chest, as he felt immense pressure being exerted onto his skin.

"Agh!" Nate winced.

Another attachment attached itself to Nate's groin and rear.

"Please, no..." Nate whined.

Body modification had become far more popular in recent years than it had ever been, mainly because technology now allowed one to change their body on a whim. Want to get rid of that beer gut? The machine can reshape your fat into muscle! If a woman wanted bigger or smaller breasts, that was possible as well.

In Nate's case, it was changing his body to match a woman of his shape and size. The attachments released and Nate craned his neck down to look at the damage. He had breasts! They weren't overly huge, but given his previous experience hadn't had any size, this was a new feeling for him. His rear had been swelled slightly as well, likely to compensate for the covering that the machine did of his groin.

"USER REQUEST: I WANT A MAN." the machine stated.

"No, I want to be a..." Nate was interrupted as the arms dragged him into another area of the mall, a lingerie store.

He was once again scanned, and a set of lingerie was placed onto his body, first a black push-up bra to hold his newly acquired breasts, and then a pair of matching panties were slid up his legs.

Nate was losing the ability to struggle as the appendages dragged him through the mall once more into a salon and sat him down in a salon chair with several attachments. Nate smiled as all of the appendages retracted.

"This might be my chance..." he thought.

Nate started to stand up, and started to run, but was immediately re-seized by the arms. The arms settled Nate down in the chair, before placing his hands and feet into the attachments on the arm foot rests. He felt something happening to them, and pressure being applied to his fingers but couldn't see. A metallic mask was placed onto his face, as the hair dryer dome was placed over his hair.

"Mmph! Mmph!" Nate failed to vocalize his protests, for all the good it would do.

He couldn't see what was happening, but he could feel his hair being pulled in every direction under the dryer. Nate squirmed and pulled, but he was held securely, until all the attachments released at once. Before he could find a mirror, the arms grabbed him, lifted him again and dragged him to another area, another changing room, but of the traditional variety, in a clothing store.

Nate didn't have time to look down at himself, because the appendages got to work immediately, pulling Nate into a tight black dress. Two more appendages quickly pierced Nate's ears, while another placed a necklace around his neck and a bracelet on his wrist. Once they seemed satisfied, the appendages placed Nate down into a pair of 3" peep-toe black heels and pulled a mirror down in front of Nate.

Nate was in shock. His hair had been styled into a loose updo that perfectly framed his face, which had been elegantly made up with smoky eyes, plump, kissable lips, and all his blemishes had been removed by the contouring that the machine had done on his face. His fingernails had been extended and were now painted with french tips, same as his toenails, which peeked out from the peep-toe black heels. The little black dress perfectly showed off Nate's new breasts, and accentuated his rear perfectly, though Nate tried to pull the skirt down, unsuccessfully. A black purse was slung over his shoulder. The transformation was staggering, Nate could scarcely believe that it was actually him, but the woman's movements perfectly matched his own.

"ENJOY YOUR NEW LOOK, KATE." the machine said.

As Nate continued to stare at his reflection, the arms grabbed him once more and dropped him by the entrance to the mall. Nate immediately rushed outside, as fast as his heeled feet could take him. Knowing he'd never make it back to his getaway car dressed like he was, he started to walk down the street, hoping to put some distance between him and the mall. Hearing sirens, he ducked into the first building he saw, a trendy bar.

As he looked for a place to sit down, he felt a tap on his shoulder. He turned around, coming face to face with a well-dressed man.

"Hi there, I'm Jason. What's your name?" the man said.

"Uh..." Nate started. "Kate."

"This might be too forward, but would you like to go out on a date with me?" Jason said, holding out his hand.

Nate wanted to tell the guy to shove off, but he had to blend in, at least until he could figure out how to get out of this get up.

"Sure." Nate said, taking Jason's hand. "Lead the way."

13424.content:
The evening passed in joyful complaining, about who'd had the worst day, or the worst life. A friendly competition with shared empathy, Circe paid her share of the rounds... more perhaps, Jessie thought.

- - - - -

His head pounded, and his mouth felt dry, as he lay in bed. Even his lips felt stuck together, a hint of her strawberry lipstick seeming to cling to him. It was a comforting warmth a cocoon against the harsh world. Turning his head, he saw only the empty bed, the quilt pulled back to allow Circe to get up.

Sinking back into the pillow, he flirted with falling back asleep. The siren call of the warmth was enticing. His apartment was quiet, straining to hear any sounds from the kitchen, toilet or living room nothing came. No sound of a breakfast being made, a shower taken, and the TV was silent.

She couldn't have left long ago, as her scent still hung in the air. Breathing it deep into his lungs, it felt more of an effort, the quilt heavier than usual, or he was more tired than he thought.

The Sun beamed through the gap beneath the curtain, it was high in the sky. A glance to the alarm clock told Jessie, it was 10:45. With a groan, he had stuff to do today. Knotting a reluctant fist into the quilt he ripped it away, as if it were a recent plaster.

- - - - -

The scream died silently in his throat, shock taking the air from his lungs. Or perhaps he should say her lungs! A voluptuous body was revealed. Erupting from the bed, from her shock. Jessie leapt to her feet, the shimmy and shake of her new body deeply disturbing, and again confirming what her eyes were telling her.

It was a soul-deep awakening, as she raced to the bathroom. Her shaving mirror reflected a gorgeous, if terrified woman back at her. She explored her own body, feeling what it was like to have her breasts mauled and kneaded like dough. To have those too large nips tweaked and twisted.

That pot-belly he'd started working on was gone now, a taut tummy, hidden between the swell of her bust, and the extra width of her hips.

Needing to hide that horror from sight, Jessie raced back to the bedroom and slipped on a thick dressing gown. Even that couldn't mask the curves she now bore. Even the act of putting it on was a reminder of her new sex. When her hair caught painfully in the collar.

Loosening it, and flicking her mane of hair free felt feminine and seductive.
